posts.title: Duska
posts.excerpt: Plot / SynopsisA socially inept middle-aged man is confronted with an unexpected guest even more clueless than himself in this comedy. Bob is a film critic from the Netherlands who loves and understands the movies but doesn’t have the same knack with the real world, especially the opposite sex. Bob is deeply infatuated with a …

posts.title: Saltimbank
posts.excerpt: Quote:The Saltim Brothers: younger Frédéric runs the family bank, while older brother Bruno turned down the executive position in exchange for financing a theater. Between them and among them, various characters navigate. The brothers each try to control their elegant niece Vanessa’s future. Café owners Eve and Jim complicate matters with their lies and betrayals, …

posts._title: Abram Room – Strogiy yunosha AKA A Severe Young Man AKA Le Jeune Sérieux (1935)
posts.title: Strogiy yunosha
posts.excerpt: A contemplation of the New Soviet Man runs head-first into a romantic comedy with music in this film from the Soviet Union, which was highly controversial upon initial release. Dr. Stepanov (Yuri Yurev) is a well-known and gifted surgeon whose talent is matched only by his arrogance; he constantly bosses around his assistant, Fydor (Maksim …
posts.titleEnglish: A Severe Young Man AKA Le Jeune Sérieux

posts._title: Franz Marischka – L’uomo dal pennello d’oro (1969)
posts.title: L’uomo dal pennello d’oro
posts.excerpt: Edwige Fenech plays the girlfriend of beatnik-hippy artist Archie (Willi Colombini). Throughout the film Edwige is either having her body painted during a hippy party, posing naked for Archie or seducing other men. All is not fun and games for Edwige though after another hippy girl (Marcella Michelangeli) has her eyes on Archie.

posts._title: Åke Sandgren – Et Rigtigt menneske AKA Truly Human (2001)
posts.title: Et Rigtigt menneske
posts.excerpt: A modern fable about an invisible man who gets the chance to become a real human being. He has to learn to be brave, honest and conscientious. ‘P’ is a fantasy figure, living behind the wallpaper in seven year-old Lisa’s bedroom. Due to the destruction of the building in which Lisa lives, P leaves Lisa …

posts._title: Robert Lepage – La Face cachée de la lune AKA The Far Side of the Moon [+extra] (2003)
posts.title: La Face cachée de la lune
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Forty-something Quebeçois Philippe Roberge is floundering in his life. He believes that no one listens to him or takes him seriously. A graduate student in Philosophy of Scientific Culture, he has just failed his Ph.D. dissertation for the second time, his theory of interest in outer space being a narcissistic response from man being widely …

posts._title: Jan Troell – Dom över död man man AKA The Last Sentence (2012)
posts.title: Dom över död man man
posts.excerpt: Dom över död man man. Torgny Segerstedt (Jesper Christensen) was one of the leading journalists in Sweden in the 20th century. As managing editor of the Gothenburg economic daily Handelstidningen, he fought a one-man battle against Adolf Hitler and fascism throughout the war years. It was a difficult fight, only made possible because of his …

posts.title: Árido Movie
posts.excerpt: Weatherman from a TV network goes back to his hometown, Vale da Rocha, a place in Northeast Brazil, devastated by the drought. He is forced to face the geographic elements and his own memories.

posts._title: Torben Skjødt Jensen – Carl Th. Dreyer: Min metier (1995)
posts.title: Carl Th Dreyer: Min metier
posts.excerpt: Quote:Torben Skjødt Jensen’s elegant documentary is a collage of memories and reflections on one of cinema’s greatest directors. Visually rich and densely layered, Carl Th. Dreyer—My Métier illuminates an artist too little understood and too important to overlook. Through interviews, historical writings, and rare archival footage, a portrait of Dreyer emerges—an austere perfectionist, yes, but …

posts._title: Nagisa Oshima – Seishun Zankoku Monogatari AKA Cruel Story of Youth (1960)
posts.title: Seishun Zankoku Monogatari
posts.excerpt: Nagisa Oshima’s groundbreaking film opens with young, attractive Mako and her friend hitching a ride from an old man. After her friend leaves, the man tries to rape her, and she is saved only by the handsome Kiyoshi. Later, against the background of the tumultuous 1960 U.S./Japan Security Treaty demonstrations, Kiyoshi and Mako walk along …
